lines.text: Second star to the right and straight on till morning.

[at Skull Rock, Peter Pan has disguised his voice to sound like Captain Hook to trick Mr. Smee into returning Princess Tiger Lily to the Indians. The real Hook notices Smee rowing past him, out of Skull Rock]
Well, at last, Captain Hook's comin' to his senses.

[surprised]
Odd's fish!

[to Tiger Lily]
I told him all along you Indians wouldn't betray Peter Pan.

[sweetly]
And just what do you think you are doing, Mr. Smee?
[He stops the rowboat from moving by placing his foot on it]
carrying out your orders.
My orders?
Why, yes, Captain. Didn't you just say to go...

[shoving Smee's rowboat back into Skull Rock]
Put her back, you blithering idiot!
[to himself]
My orders. Of all the bumbling...
[first lines]

All this has happened before, and it will all happen again. But this time it happened in London. It happened on a quiet street in Bloomsbury. That corner house over there is the home of the Darling family. And Peter Pan chose this particular house because there were people here who believed in him.
Tinker Bell! I hereby banish you forever.
Please, not forever.
Well, for a week then.
He can fly!
He can fly!
He flewed!
Now you try.
I'll think of a mermaid lagoon, underneath a magic moon.
I'll think I'm in a pirate's cave.
I think I'll be an Indian brave.
Now everybody try.
One, two, three!
We can fly! We can fly! We can fly!
[the children all fall to the ground]
This won't do. What's the matter with you? All it takes is faith and trust. Oh! And something I forgot.
[grabs Tinkerbell]
Dust!
Dust?
Dust?
Yep, just a little bit of pixie dust.
[taps Tinkerbell a bit with his hand to make golden dust come off and rain down on the kids]
Now, think of the happiest things. It's the same as having wings.

[seeing the pirate ship floating in the sky back to Never Land]
You know, I have the strangest feeling that I've seen that ship before. A long time ago, when I was very young.
[the pirates see Peter Pan and the Darling children coming, so they get ready to shoot them down]
I've waited years for this.
That's not countin' the holidays, either.
[At Skull Rock, Peter Pan is out of Smee's sight impersonating Captain Hook]
Mr. Smee! Just exactly what do you think you're doing?
Putting her back like you said, Captain.
I said nothing of the sort!
Oh, uh... b-but Cap...
For the last time, Mr. Smee, take the princess back to her people!
[screams]
*UNDERSTAND*?
Aye, aye, sir.
Oh, and one more thing. When you return to the ship, tell the whole crew to help themselves to me best rum.
Girls talk too much!
Well? Get on with it, girl!
My name is Wendy. Wendy Moira Angela Darling.
Wendy's enough.
But, George, do you think the children will be safe without Nana?
Safe? Of course they'll be safe. Why not?
Well, Wendy said something about a shadow, and I...
Shadow? Whose shadow?
Peter Pan's.
Oh, Peter Pan... Peter Pan! You don't say!

[high, mocking voice]
Goodness gracious, whatever shall we do?
But George...
Sound the alarm!
Really, I...
Call Scotland Yard!

[about to lower a bomb into Peter Pan's hideout]
And now, Smee, to take care of master Peter Pan.
But, Captain, wouldn't it be more humane-like to slit his throat?
Aye, that it would, Mr Smee. But I have given me word not to lay a finger, or a hook, on Peter Pan. And Captain Hook never breaks a promise.
[Wendy has walked the plank, and Peter saves her]
No splash, Captain.
So, you want a splash, Mr Starkey? I'll give you a splash!
[Hook throws Mr Starkey overboard]
Who's next?
You're next, Hook! This time you've gone too far!
Well, well, a codfish on a hook.
I'll get you for this, Pan, if it's the last thing I do!
I think I had a mother once.
What was she like?
I forget.
I had a white rat.
That's no mother!
You wouldn't do ol' Hook in now, would you, lad? I'll go away forever.
[tearfully]
I'll do anything you say.
Well, all right... if you... say you're a codfish.

[gulps]
I'm a codfish.
Louder!

[wailing]
I'M A CODFISH!
How did Nana get your shadow, Peter?
Chomped at me the other night at the window.
But what were you doing there?
I came to listen to your stories.
My stories? But they're all about you.
Of course! That's why I like 'em!
[Captain Hook and Mr. Smee have decided to kidnap Wendy so Peter Pan would never see her again]
Come, Smee, we must leave immediately. We'll surround Peter's home...
But Captain, we don't know where Peter Pan lives.
Great Scott, you're right, Smee!
[Tinker Bell flies over to them and then flies over to a map of Never Land]
What's that, my dear? You could show us the way? Why, I never thought of that.
[to Smee]
Take this down, Smee.
"Take this down, Smee." Aye-aye, Captain.
[Smee takes out a quill pen and a piece of paper while Tinker Bell dips her shoes in an inkwell and then lands on a part of the Never Land map marked Pegleg Point]
Start at Pegleg Point...

[writing in the paper]
"Start at Pegleg Point... "
[Tinker Bell walks across the map to another area marked Blindman's Bluff]
Forty paces west to Blindman's Bluff...

[writing]
"Blindman's Bluff... "
[Tinker Bell hops across a part of the map with a creek on it and then walks toward the northeastern end of the map]

[nervously]
Yes, yes. A hop, skip and a jump across Crocodile Creek and then nor' by nor'east, one, two, three...
[loses patience]
Well, get on with...
[calms down]
Continue, my dear.
[Tinker Bell suddenly gets angry and she flies up in Hook's face, wagging her finger at him]
I mustn't harm Peter? Madam, Captain Hook gives his word not to lay a finger...
[Tinker Bell hooks her finger]
... or a hook... on Peter Pan.
[Tinker Bell flies over to an area of the Never Land map marked Hangman's Tree and puts an X on it with her inked shoe heels]
Ah, Hangman's Tree! So *that's* the entrance to his hiding place!
[Hook grabs Tinker Bell and locks her in a lantern]
Thank you, me dear, you've been most helpful.
[outside the door where Captain Hook is sitting with a cold]
[holding a hammer]
Shhhh! The Captain has a splitting headache. We mustn't annoy him.

[looking away as Captain Hook comes out, about to attack Mr. Smee when Mr. Smee accidentally hits Captain Hook in the forehead with the hammer. Mr. Smee vibrates as Captain Hook staggers back into the room and collapses back onto the chair. Dazed. Smee walks in with a kettle of hot water. Takes a look at Captain Hook]
Well, Captain. It's nice to see you smiling again. Brings back the good old days when we was leading a healthy, normal life, scuttling ships, cutting throats.
[Puts a thermometer in Captain Hook's mouth]
Oh Captain, why don't we go to sea again?
[starts pouring the hot water into the bucket where Captain Hook's feet are]
You know, there's trouble brewing on the island. Women trouble. I wouldn't want this to go any farther, but...
[not realizing the bucket is filling with hot water]
the cook told me, that the first mate told him...
[the thermometer in Captain Hook's mouth starts to rise as Captain Hook's face turns red]
...that he heard... that Pan has banished Tinkerbell.
[the thermometer pops at the end]
WOOOOOAH!
[Jumps up off the chair out of the bucket of hot water with his feet red hot and bumps his head against the ceiling as Smee falls over]
Why you doddering imbecile, I...
[pulls the kettle off of his head]
Did you say Pan has banished Tinkerbell?

[referring to Tinker Bell]
Oh, look! A firefly!
A pixie.
Amazing!
[Tinker Bell angrily gestures at Peter]
What's the pixie doing?
Talking.
What did she say?
She says you're a big ugly girl!
[everybody laughs]
Oh... well, I think she's lovely.
[the time bomb that Hook had delivered Peter had just gone off]
So passes on a worthy opponent.
Amen.
I say, Captain, do you hear something?
But, Peter, how do we get to Never Land?
Fly, of course.
Fly?
It's easy! All you have to do is to... is to... is to... Ha! That's funny.
What's the matter? Don't you know?
Oh, sure. It's... It's just that I never thought about it before. Say, that's it! You think of a wonderful thought.
Oh, dear, dear, dear, Captain Hook. Shooting a man in the middle of his cadenza? That ain't good form, you know.
"Good form," Mr. Smee?
[suddenly yelling]
Blast good form!
[waves his hook in front of Smee]
Did Pan show good form when he did *this* to me?
Why, Captain, cutting your hand off was only a childish prank, you might say.
Aye, but throwing it to that crocodile! That cursed beast liked the taste of me so well he's followed me ever since, licking his chops for the rest of me.
And he would've had you by now, Captain, if he hadn't swallowed that alarm clock. But now, when he's about, he'd warn you, as you might say, with his tick-tock, tick-tock, tick-tock.
Fly! Fly! Fly! You coward!
Coward! Me?
Ha-ha-ha! You wouldn't dare fight old Hook man-to-man. You'd fly away like a cowardly sparrow!
Nobody calls Pan a coward and lives! I'll fight you man-to-man, with one hand behind my back.
You mean you won't fly?
No, don't, Peter! It's a trick!
I give my word, Hook.
Good, then let's have at it!
Wendy, haven't I warned you? Stuffing the boys heads with a lot of silly stories?
Oh, but they aren't.
I say they are. Captain Crook! Peter Pirate!
Peter Pan, Father.
Pan... Pirate... Poppycock!
Oh, no, Father!
Oh my gosh!
How can you...?
Absolute poppycock!
You can't stick it on with soap, Peter. It needs sewing. That's the proper way to do it. Although, come to think of it, I've never thought about it before... um... sewing shadows, I mean.
Squaw get 'em firewood!
Squaw no get 'em firewood! Squaw go home!
What's the chief doing, John?
He's giving an oration in sign language.
What's he saying?
He says... "Peter Pan... mighty warrior... save Tigerlily... make big chief... heap glad."

[jokingly]
Well, he certainly doesn't look "heap glad".
How.
How, Chief. How.
For many moons, red man fight paleface Lost Boys.
Ugh.
Sometime, you win; sometime, we win.
Okay, Chief. You win this time. Now turn us loose.
Turn us loose? You mean this is only a game?
Sure. When we win, we turn them loose.
When they win, they turn us loose.
This time, no turnum loose.
Huh?
[laughs]
The chief's a great spoofer!
Me no spoofum! Where you hide Princess Tiger Lily?
Uh, Tiger Lily?
We ain't got your ol' princess!
I certainly have never seen her.
Me neither.
Heap big lie! If Tiger Lily not back by sunset... burnum at stake.
Now, George...
"Now, George". "Now, George"! Well, "now, George" will have his say!
Oh! Mother, we're back!
Back?
All except the lost boys. They were not quite ready.
Lost boys? Ready?
To grow up. That's why they went back to Neverland.
Neverland?
Well... I am.
Uh... ready to grow up.
Oh, oh! Well, my dear...
Oh, we had such a wonderful time! Well, except when we were kidnapped...
Kidnapped?
We had lots of fun with Tinker Bell, and the mermaids, and Peter Pan! Oh, he was the most wonderful person of them all! And then we called him a codfish!
[giggles]
Uh... Captain Hook, I mean.
[calms down and starts talking in a dreamy tone]
And then... we sailed away on a ship in the sky.

[weirded out by Wendy's story, yawns]
Mary, I'm going to bed.

[as he and Capt. Hook hear the sound of Tick-Tock]
I say, Captain, do you hear something?

[trembles in fear]
No.
[ticking getting closer]
No!
[Tick-Tock comes up from the water and bites Hook]
Nooo!

[as Captain Hook]
Blast you, Peter Pan!

[as Peter Pan]
Take that! Give up, Captain Hook? You give up?
Never! I'll teach you to cut off me hand!

[coming in; chuckling]
Oh, no, John, it was the *left* hand.
Oh, yes. Thank you, Wendy.
[Mr. Darling is putting out Nana for the night and he leashes her with a rope to her doghouse. She looks at him sadly]

Dash it all, Nana, don't look at me like that. It's nothing personal, it's just that... well, you're not really a nurse at all, you're... well, a dog. And the children aren't puppies, they're people. And sooner or later, Nana, people have to grow up.
George, dear, do hurry. We mustn't be late for the party, you know.
Mrs. Darling believed that Peter Pan was a great hero, but Mr. Darling...
Mary, unless I find my cufflinks, we don't go to the party! If we don't go to the party, I can never show my face in the office again! If I could ever...
[hits his head on the drawer]
Ouch!
Well... Mr. Darling was a practical man.
A jealous female can be tricked into anything.
Don't you understand, Tink? You mean more to me than anything in this whole world!
Mr. Crocodile, do you like codfish?
[crocodile nods]
You *do*?
[Mr. Smee has captured a brooding Tinker Bell and taken her to Captain Hook, who is playing the piano, while Smee is drinking]
Yes, Miss Bell, Captain Hook admits defeat. Tomorrow, I leave the island, never to return.
I'm glad to hear that, Captain.
[he hiccups]
I'll tell the crew and...
[he hiccups again and tries to leave, but Hook trips him up and he falls down]

[to Tinker Bell]
And that's why I asked you over, me dear, to tell Peter I bear him no ill will. Oh, Pan has his faults, to be sure. Bringing that Wendy to the island, for instance. Dangerous business, that. Why, rumor has it that already she has come between you and Peter.
[he notices that Tinker Bell is on the verge of tears]
But what's this? Tears? Then it *is* true.
[to Smee]
taking the best years of her life and then casting her aside like an old glove!

[crying]
Ain't it a bloomin'...
[he hiccups]
... shame?

[handing a handkerchief to Tinker Bell]
But we musn't judge Peter too harshly, my dear. It's that Wendy who's to blame.
[Tinker Ball nods in agreement; Hook then turns to Smee]
Mr. Smee, we must save the lad from himself. But how?
[Smee just cries]
We've so little time; we sail in the morning. Sail? That's it, Smee!
[he slaps Smee on the back and Smee falls down again]
We'll shanghai Wendy!
Shanghai Wendy, Captain?
Take her to sea with us. With her gone, Peter will soon forget this mad infatuation.

[referring to Neverland]
This ain't no place for a respectable pirate.
Blast that Peter Pan! If I could only find his hideout, I'd trap him in his lair. But where is it?
[He examines a map of Neverland]
Mermaid Lagoon? No, we've search that. And we've combed Cannibal Cove.
[He then lands his hook on an area of the map marked Indian Camp]
Here! No. No, no, no, that's Indian territ... But wait. Those redskins know this island better than I do me own ship. Ah, I wonder.

[walking up]
Good morning, Captain.

[grabbing Smee]
I've got it! Tiger Lily, Smee!

[nervously]
T-T-Tiger Lily, Captain?
The chief's daughter. She'll know where Pan is hiding.
B-B-But-But will she talk, Captain?
Oh, a little persuasion might be in order. Now let me see... Boiling in oil? Uh, keelhauling? Eh, marooning?

[singing]
Crook... crook... crickety-crockety crickety-crook, the croc is after Captain Hook -
[Hook hits him on the head]
What a pity, Mr Smee. I'm afraid we've lost the dear Captain.
Well, I'm certainly proud of you... you blockheads!

[catching Mr. Smee leaving his cabin]
And where do you think you are going?
To tell the boys we sails with the tide, sir.
You will go ashore, pick up Tinker Bell, and bring her to me.
[shouts]
UNDERSTAND?

[saluting Hook]
Aye-aye sir!
[Mr. Smee charges through the wall, lands in a boat, goes flying overboard and rows to the shore very fast]

[Catches Tinkerbell using his hat as a sack]
Begging your pardon Miss Bell, but Captain Hook would like a word with you.
